resources.string: When TalkBack is on, your device provides spoken feedback to help blind and low-vision users. For example, it describes what you touch, select, and activate.
There are currently no custom labels. You can create one by navigating to an unlabeled image and then adding a label from the Local Context Menu.
Touch the screen and explore in a circle to find an item, then lift to select.
Touch the screen and explore in a circle to navigate on-screen content, then lift to focus.
Notifications are spoken when the screen is off
No speech occurs when the screen is off
Proximity sensor does not control speech
Phonetic letters will be spoken when long pressing on the keyboard and moving by character.
Usage hints won\'t be spoken during linear navigation.
Usage hints will be spoken when focus is moved by linear navigation, after a brief delay.
Dim screen when TalkBack is enabled
(Experimental) Tap on currently focused item to select
Open TalkBack at the Play Store
Search the screen for an item
Press key combination to set new shortcut. It must contain at least ALT or Control key.
This key combination is used for \'%1$s\' action. Do you want to clear it and assign this shortcut to \'%2$s\'?
Speak keyboard feedback in a lower-pitched voice
Don\'t change voice pitch when speaking
Decrease other audio volume while speaking
Download accessibility scripts for web content
TalkBack accessibility service has dimmed the screen.
Undo by pressing Volume Up and Volume Down keys together three times quickly.
Screen dim can be controlled from TalkBack Settings.
Navigate by default web view behavior.
Tap to review changes to accessibility gestures

Are you sure? Your device will not provide feedback and Explore by Touch will be disabled. You can resume TalkBack from notifications, by returning to the lockscreen, or through the volume key shortcut.
You can resume TalkBack from the notifications shade.
You can resume TalkBack from the notifications shade or by turning the screen on.
You can resume TalkBack from the notifications shade or by returning to the lock screen.
Enter the text to be used for this image in the field below.
Are you sure you want to remove the \"%1$s\" label?
Are you sure you want to remove the \"%1$s\" label within %2$s?

This version of TalkBack includes changes to the default accessibility gestures. The actions associated with these gestures can be customized within TalkBack settings. When Explore by touch is enabled, you can use the following gestures to perform certain actions.\n\n%1$s
Long press volume up and down keys
Are you sure you want to dim the screen?

This version of TalkBack includes changes to the default accessibility gestures.

The up-then-down gesture will allow you to move to the first item on the screen, and the down-then-up gesture will move to the last item.

The reading granularity can now be changed by focusing an item, then selecting a granularity from the local context menu.

You can change the actions performed by these gestures in TalkBack Settings.
Are you sure you want to turn off Explore by touch?\n\nYour device will no longer respond to shortcut gestures or speak items when you touch the screen.
Are you sure you want to turn on node tree debugging?\n\nNode tree debugging exposes the content of your screen to your device\'s logs, which may be read by other applications.
Explore by touch is not available in web content. Turn on %1$s in Accessibility settings to explore web content.
Permission to send gestures to TalkBack and resume spoken feedback.
Permission to access, modify, and delete custom labels spoken by TalkBack.
